page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Geologically the area attracts a great deal of attention having one of the widest age-ranges and rock types in Britain. It merits its own literature, described in geology of the Appleby District" and the local deposits of lead were one reason for the development of settlement here. (See local history section). In geological times the area was also affected by volcanic activity and later glaciation, leaving dramatic landforms like the nearby High Cup Gill with its steep cliffs of volcanic whin sill and the distinctive conical shape of Murton Pike. The hillsides are scarred by crags of both limestone and sandstone, both of which have been quarried for building.
